page.title: 02NEW HARTLEY (CONTINUED)
page.content: The old mine houses still stood and families still lived in them but the houses were unfit to live in. The{NCB}wanted to demolish the houses but{Lord Hastings}wanted to keep them. The occupants only rented them so they could be evicted at any time. Lord Hastings let them stay. He sent to the Government for an improvement grant. He got five and a half thousand pounds for each house, but the cost was seven thousand pounds. Lord Hastings sold the houses for ten thousand pounds. Then he built some more houses until he made the village as it is today.
